4.verse_text: What this adds up to, then, is this: no more lies, no more pretense. Tell your neighbor the truth. In Christ"s body we"re all connected to each other, after all. When you lie to others, you end up lying to yourself.
Did you use to make ends meet by stealing? Well, no more! Get an honest job so that you can help others who can"t work.
Watch the way you talk. Let nothing foul or dirty come out of your mouth. Say only what helps, each word a gift.
Don"t grieve God. Don"t break his heart. His Holy Spirit, moving and breathing in you, is the most intimate part of your life, making you fit for himself. Don"t take such a gift for granted.

5.verse_text: You can be sure that using people or religion or things just for what you can get out of them–the usual variations on idolatry–will get you nowhere, and certainly nowhere near the kingdom of Christ, the kingdom of God.
Don"t live carelessly, unthinkingly. Make sure you understand what the Master wants.
Out of respect for Christ, be courteously reverent to one another.

6.verse_text: Fathers, don"t frustrate your children with no-win scenarios. Take them by the hand and lead them in the way of the Master.
Masters, it"s the same with you. No abuse, please, and no threats. You and your servants are both under the same Master in heaven. He makes no distinction between you and them.
